summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2020 between the UK National Crime Agency (NCA) and the FBI regarding the sharing of financial intelligence related to Jeffrey Epstein. The NCA offers to provide financial intelligence on Epstein via FinCEN and inquires about an internal NSPCC investigation into an entity named 'IVEAGH'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the financial intelligence being shared between the NCA and FBI. Mentioned in the context of a US bank account.

events.title: Meeting between NCA and FBI
events.description: A meeting last January between the NCA and FBI regarding the FBI/DOJ enquiry into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: NCA inquiry regarding IVEAGH
events.description: The NCA inquires whether an internal NSPCC investigation into 'IVEAGH' would adversely affect the FBI's investigation.

locations: British Embassy, 3100 Massachusetts Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20008
keyFacts: The UK National Crime Agency (NCA) was actively sharing financial intelligence related to Jeffrey Epstein with the FBI in 2020.
The NCA referenced financial intelligence regarding a US bank account associated with Epstein.
The NCA inquired about a potential conflict with an internal NSPCC investigation into an entity named 'IVEAGH'.
Communication indicates ongoing international cooperation in the Epstein investigation post his death.
All email addresses and the names of the specific FBI and NCA officers are redacted in the document.
